objective: Delay outgoing payments strategically to conserve cash and optimize cashflow.

strategies.description: Discuss with suppliers to extend payment terms from standard (e.g., Net 30) to longer (e.g., Net 45 or Net 60).
Pay a portion of the invoice now and schedule the remainder later.
strategies.impact: Maintains supplier relationship while easing immediate cash pressure.

strategies.description: Rank invoices by importance and due date; pay critical vendors first.
strategies.impact: Delays non-essential payments without disrupting operations.

strategies.description: Use supplier-provided financing or third-party pay-later programs.
strategies.impact: Defers cash outflow while ensuring supplier is paid on time.

strategies.description: Use business credit cards to pay suppliers, leveraging billing cycles to delay cash outflow.
strategies.impact: Extends payment window by 15-45 days depending on card terms.

strategies.description: Request clarifications or dispute parts of an invoice if errors exist.
strategies.impact: Provides legitimate delay while resolving discrepancies.

strategies.description: Combine multiple smaller payments into one larger batch at a later date.
strategies.impact: Improves control over outgoing cash and reduces transaction overhead.
